name: Crest Hotel Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was ideally located - one block to beach, Lincoln Road. For the price of $125/night, we had no complaints. Rooms are basic, bathroom even smaller, but not an issue while there for a weekend. Front desk friendly, some metered parking out front on James Ave, lot across the stret is $30/night.
reviews.title: Crest Suites Miami Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a stay in South Beach Miami. We chose the Crest Hotel from the previous reviews on tripadvisor. We were very pleased with the hotel. The room was very nice and clean, the service was very accomodating. We needed an extra blanket and had one within minutes. When we needed fax service while we were there, we were able to receive and send a fax via the hotels fax machine for no charge.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The location could not be any better. It is within a block of Lincoln street shopping and dining , and a block and a half from the beach
reviews.title: Not impressed

likes.liked: — Closeness to baech and Convention Centre

reviews.title: dont do it unless u have 2
reviews.text: The only negative is that there is no parking available at the hotel. There is a parking lot across the street but they charge by the hour. We were able to use the valet service from the hotel next door and had our car parked for $25.00 for 24 hours. You could get your car whenever you needed it but we never needed it as everything is within walking distance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was very nice and reasonably priced for the area.
reviews.title: Nice out of the way hotel

likes.disliked: — Cheaper than most hotels in the area.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Crest for just one night and then the next morning had little tiny red bites all over my legs consistent with bed bugs - GROSS!! DO NOT stay here unless you want to get bitten and possibly bring home bed bugs in your luggage!!! Disgusting.
reviews.title: Good location, but this place has BED BUGS!!!!

reviews.text: I have no complaints about the Crest Hotel. Location was great and everything was within walking didtance. Rooms were nicley sized and the staff were very friendly. I would absolutley recommend this hotel and I will plan on staying here again!
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.text: I stayed at the Crest Hotel and Suites during the busy memorial weekend holiday,and had a fantastic stay! Me and 3 girlfriends stayed in the deluxe double studio suite. It was very spacious, and the perfect accommodate for a classy group of young women. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful, and the maid service was immaculate. We say no roaches/bugs, and the rooms were cleaned to a "t" daily. We asked for fresh towels a few times a day, and the response was always very fast. The location is also great, close enough to all of the action, but far away enough that we could avoid the hustle/bustle of busy Collins Ave and the crowds. I would highly recommend the Crest to anyone looking for a very nice and affordable place to stay in South Beach!!
reviews.title: The Crest Hotel is a wonderful place to stay
GREAT location!
reviews.text: Great Location. A few meters away from Licoln Road (to be precise 35 meters). A 3 minute walk distance from the beach.
Very friendly staff. Very clean rooms. No roaches in miles. Free wifi. Free daily newspapers. Fantastic price.
reviews.title: Ok

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Crest over July 4th weekend. We went to relax, sunbathe and party. The Crest was excellent. We stayed in a suite, not a standard room. The room was on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool. I think it was room 601, but I'm not sure. The room was perfect for the 2 of us. It had a full kitchenette with stove/fridge/sink/microwave as well as dishes and silverware. There was a livingroom area with a fold out couch and a table with 2 chairs. The bedroom had a very comfortable king bed and big closet with drawers built in. The closet served as a room divider between the living room and bedroom. There was a 19 inch television that was on a swivel in a "cut-out" built into the closet so that you can watch it in the living room or turn it to watch tv in the bedroom. I saw no ants and have no complaints about the suite. I never saw the standard room but I recommend the suite for sure. The only complaint i have about the room is that there was no stereo/cd player, but I had travel speakers for the beach so we just hooked that up to the iPod whenever we wanted tunes. The pool is not huge but it was perfectly acceptable. The area is good because you can get supplies at walgreens and Lincoln Rd is down the block. There's a great cuban restaurant around the corner on Collins ave. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Time

reviews.text: My sisters and I (all of us above 27 years of age) stayed at the Crest for a weekend gettaway. We did not spend too much time in the room, and skipped the pool entirely. We also avoided the restaurant based on other users' reviews, tending to go out to eat at places like La Sandwicherie (14th and Washington--highly recommended) and Jerry's Diner. We had a few ants in our room as noted in other reviews, but they were really nothing to write home about. Our space was small, but not lacking. The beds were comfortable and the room was pretty well cleaned. You could hear people outside walking by, but once again we spent little time in the room. For the price and the location I may try Crest again. I wouldn't be scared to, but I'd like to find something maybe a little more ameanable for not much more.
reviews.title: Perfectly doable...

reviews.text: I stayed at the Crest with my boyfriend in May 2006. Our room was very clean, with a huge bed which was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was a nice size and also very clean. The maid service was excellent - they cleaned and tidied our room every day to very good standards.
reviews.title: Clean, peaceful and great location

reviews.text: The room was also nice and quiet, so easy to relax in after a hard days sunbathing and nice to get ready in to go out to all the bars/clubs!!
reviews.title: Lovely Room - Clean and organized
Contemporary Elegance
reviews.text: The location was great, just off Lincoln Road, a block from the beach, and car parking directly opposite.

I stayed in the Crest Hotel for two nights over a weekend. The location was great and the room was spartan but clean. I was a bit disappointed that I had specifically called the hotel a few weeks before staying to verify that they had cots available but when I requested one I was told that they did not have any. Perhaps they were just all in use? We did have some ants in the bathroom but I get the feeling this is a continual battle in that kind of climate. I would have to rate our overall stay as average for these reasons but value wise ($155/night) it can't be beat.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: I stayed at the Crest Hotel Suites while attending a conference at the Miami Beach Convention Centre. The location could not be beat. The hotel is a block and a half to the convention centre, same distance to the beach, and a half a block to Lincoln road (great for restaurants and shopping). The location was surprisingly quiet for being so close to a busy street. Just in case of noise, we kept the room fan on at night, which kept the temperature comfortable and muffeled any outside noise there may have been. We heard some hallway noise, but nothing from the rooms beside us (also filled with conference attendees).
reviews.title: great location, comfortable, and clean

likes.disliked: — pool was not heated - too cool to go in on our November trip

reviews.text: The hotel itself was very clean (room was cleaned very well everyday, while we were out). The staff were very friendly and accomodating. They called us cabs and gave directions when we needed them. We had a little trouble with the temperature of our shower and they fixed it the same day we told them about it. I stayed in a double studio suite with one of my collegues. It was a perfect set up for us, with full kitchenette, including fridge, stove, microwave, dishes, and coffee maker (bring your own coffee). There was a livingroom area divided from a sleeping area, and a typical hotel bathroom. Another collegue had a regular room, that was very small, with a tiny bathroom. Again, she was happy there on her own, but would have found it cramped if she had shared the room. The rooms have recently been updated and beds were very comfortable. There are blankets in the wardrobe. There was free internet access in the Lobby.
reviews.title: Perfect location and a clean, safe hotel

reviews.text: We were very happy to have stayed at the Crest Hotel Suites and would highly recommend it to people wanting to be close to the convention centre or Licoln Road.
reviews.title: What a DIVE!

reviews.text: The Crest Hotel Suites was a nice, if spartan, hotel that I would recommend and return to without hesitation. It was certainly not a dive, as a previous reviewer stated. It was very clean, safe, FABULOUSLY located, quiet, and reasonably priced. We paid $150/night for a small room with two comfortable double beds and a very clean, but very small bathroom. We stayed in a "standard" room, not a suite, and did not have a refrigerator or microwave in our room. We were on the 2nd floor and stayed at the hotel Nov. 27-28, 2006
reviews.title: Good location, value for money

description: This unique contemporary boutique hotel is located in the heart of South Beach's Art deco District. Walking distance to world famous Ocean Drive, Lincoln Rd Mall restaurants, nightlife and sandy beaches. Renovated in a contemporary style that provides all the conveniences required by today's travelers.
